Class Questionnaire

java.lang.Object
Questionnaire
Direct Known Subclasses:
FillInTheBlanks, MultipleChoice, ShortAnswer
public abstract class Questionnaire
extends java.lang.Object
This is the base class which is the framework for all of the other question classes derived from it. Because the Questionnaire class is abstract, it cannot be instantiated directly.
Since:
2/27/2021
Author:
Austin Piper

  • Field Details

    • question_amount

      private static int question_amount
      Keeps track of how many Questionnaire-derived objects have been created. It is used to assign each question within a program run-through a unique number.

    • question_number

      private int question_number
      Represents what question number the current question object is.

    • question_intro

      private java.lang.String question_intro
      A String that introduces the question and says what kind of response is expected. Question intros are hard-coded and pre-set according to the Questionnaire subclass type.

    • question

      private java.lang.String question
      This contains the actual question (in words) that is to be answered.

  • Constructor Details

    • Questionnaire

      Questionnaire​(java.lang.String input_question_intro, java.lang.String input_question)
      The Questionnaire constructor sets the question being asked, as well as its introduction according to given inputs. This constructor is only ever called by its subclass' constructors.
      Parameters:
      input_question_intro - The introduction explaining how to answer the question. This string is typically hard-coded into each subclass' constructor.
      input_question - The question which is going to be asked in String form

  • Method Details

    • getQuestion_intro

      public java.lang.String getQuestion_intro()
      Returns the question's introduction as a String
      Returns:
      The predefined intro to the current Questionnaire as a String

    • getQuestion

      public java.lang.String getQuestion()
      Returns:
      The actual question that is going to be asked in String form.

    • setQuestion

      protected void setQuestion​(java.lang.String new_question)
      This method sets the contents of the 'question' String. It is intended for use within subclass methods only. Subclasses may use this to better format the question for presentation. It is intentionally protected because giving outside clients access to it could unpredictably cause confusion. For example, if an outside client changes the contents of a question, but kept the already-given responses the same.
      Parameters:
      new_question - What the given question will become

    • getQuestionNumber

      public int getQuestionNumber()
      Returns:
      The number that the question is within the current survey

    • obtainResponse

      public abstract void obtainResponse​(java.lang.String input_response)
      This abstract method is implemented differently by each subclass, and stores a given answer as appropriate.
      Parameters:
      input_response - The response to the question in String form.

    • showResponse

      public abstract java.lang.String showResponse()
      This abstract method is implemented differently by each subclass, and returns the response received (if there is one) in String form
      Returns:
      the question's response in String form
